briefdescription.para: Creates a full file path by combining the current selected directory (CSD) with a relative path.

detaileddescription.para: If the given path is absolute (starts with '/'), it returns the path as is. If it is relative, it combines it with the current selected directory (CSD).

parameterdescription.para: The relative file path to be converted into an absolute path

simplesect.para: The full file path as a string

briefdescription.para: Reads a string from input.

detaileddescription.para: This function reads a string from user input or a defined source. It is typically used for getting string input from the user during program execution.

briefdescription.para: Reads a single byte from the file.

detaileddescription.para: This function reads a single byte from the file specified by the file descriptor.

simplesect.para: The byte read from the file

briefdescription.para: Handles the OPENIN statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: Since OPENIN is a function in Retro Rocket BASIC, this statement is not supported and raises an error.

briefdescription.para: Handles the OPENUP statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: Since OPENUP is a function in Retro Rocket BASIC, this statement is not supported and raises an error.

briefdescription.para: Handles the OPENOUT statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: Since OPENOUT is a function in Retro Rocket BASIC, this statement is not supported and raises an error.

briefdescription.para: Handles the READ statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: Since the READ statement is not supported in Retro Rocket BASIC (as it relies on DATA statements), this function raises an error.

briefdescription.para: Handles the DATA statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: The DATA statement is not supported in Retro Rocket BASIC. This function raises an error, suggesting to use files instead.

briefdescription.para: Handles the RESTORE statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: Since DATA statements are not supported in Retro Rocket BASIC, this function raises an error indicating there is nothing to restore.

briefdescription.para: Handles the CLOSE statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: This function closes the file associated with the file descriptor returned by the OPEN statement.

briefdescription.para: Handles the EOF function in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: The EOF function checks whether the end of file has been reached. It is not supported in Retro Rocket BASIC. This function raises an error.

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for reading.

detaileddescription.para: This function opens a file in read-only mode and returns the file descriptor.

simplesect.para: The file descriptor for the opened file

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for writing.

detaileddescription.para: This function opens a file in write-only mode and returns the file descriptor.

simplesect.para: The file descriptor for the opened file

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for both reading and writing.

detaileddescription.para: This function opens a file in read-write mode and returns the file descriptor.

simplesect.para: The file descriptor for the opened file

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of items (files) in the directory.

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the number of items (files) in the specified directory.

simplesect.para: The number of items in the directory

briefdescription.para: Returns the name of a file or directory at a specified index.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the name of a file or directory at the specified index in the directory.

simplesect.para: The name of the file or directory at the specified index

briefdescription.para: Returns the type of a file or directory (either "file" or "directory").

detaileddescription.para: This function checks if the specified path corresponds to a directory or a regular file.

simplesect.para: A string indicating whether the path is a "file" or "directory"

briefdescription.para: Gets the size of a file in a directory.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the size of a file at the specified index in the directory.

simplesect.para: The size of the file at the specified index

briefdescription.para: Checks if the end of file (EOF) is reached.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks whether the specified file descriptor has reached the end of the file.

simplesect.para: Returns 1 if EOF is reached, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Handles the MKDIR statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a new directory at the specified path.

briefdescription.para: Handles the MOUNT statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: This function mounts a file system at the specified path, allowing access to the device.

briefdescription.para: Handles the RMDIR statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: This function removes a directory from the file system.

briefdescription.para: Handles the DELETE statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: This function deletes the specified file from the file system.

briefdescription.para: Handles the WRITE statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: This function writes data to the file specified by the file descriptor. The data is retrieved from the printable syntax of the variable.

briefdescription.para: Creates a RAM disk from a specified device.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a RAM disk from the specified device and returns a string identifier.

simplesect.para: The identifier of the created RAM disk

briefdescription.para: Creates a RAM disk with a specified size.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a RAM disk with the specified number of blocks and block size, and returns a string identifier.

simplesect.para: The identifier of the created RAM disk

briefdescription.para: Gets the current selected directory (like getcwd in C).

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the path of the current working directory, which is the directory where the program is currently operating from.

simplesect.para: The path of the current working directory

briefdescription.para: Handles the CHDIR statement in BASIC.

detaileddescription.para: This function changes the current selected directory (CSD) for the running process.

briefdescription.para: BASIC file functions.
